page.title: 14SCHOOLS
page.content: Croughton CofE (Controlled) Primary School is housed in a new school opened in 1977. The previous stone, thatched building was built in 1886, and had become impractical for modern educational practice. It now houses the village playgroup and the Rural Schools Educational Project, set up to help enrich the scope of the syllabus in rural schools. The Primary School currently has 34 on the roll, and a staff of Headmaster, Infant teacher and a part timer. A cook produces meals on the premises. Certain events of the school year, such as the Christmas Plays, are focal points for the older members of the community. After the age of 11, most children attend Magdalen College School, Brackley. A few under 11's go to school in Brackley; some ten village children are educated privately.
